results.content:
In the course you first get thought something basic, then something slightly more difficult, and after that something difficult, so it is very hard to follow along. 

In the course, one is required to use if/else prior to being though the subject, and it is the same with math.round. 

It do also have a fair amount of errors, so one might not get the right results even if the code is 100% like the authors. 

This course would need twice as much data and I ended up choosing a course with a higher rating here on Udemy instead and I only wish I would not have wasted so much time on this course. 

I often times felt stupid while doing this course, but eventually found out I just needed to change instructor.

results.content: I think this course has all the content it needs to cover the basics and some advanced techniques in JavaScript. My only issue with this course is that it is way too long. It offers way too much content and too many project that I thought it would be better if it were split into multiple shorter courses.

results.content: the course starts off strong, and it does an ok job once it gets into website development, but it drops off pretty sharp after that. the svelt stuff I feel should be its own course.

results.content: Very detailed, but not overwhelmingly slow. I have taken other JavaScript courses before and they were either too fast for me or way too slow. This course is a happy medium! Great for beginners, but also good for developers who aren't used to working with JavaScript and need a refresher!

Great for beginners, but also good for developers who aren't used to working with JavaScript and need a refresher!
